item.title: What is Eid al-Fitr? 6 questions about the holiday, answered
item.description: Eid al-Fitr marks the end of Ramadan and features two to three days of celebration.

item.title: Trial on tap for California man in stabbing death being called a hate crime
item.description: Samuel Woodward is accused of stabbing Blaze Bernstein to death six years ago. Prosecutors say Woodward's cellphone had lots of anti-gay, antisemitic and hate group materials.

item.title: Watch Live: James and Jennifer Crumbley, parents of Oxford High School shooter, to be sentenced
item.description: Prosecutors are seeking 10 to 15 years in prison for James and Jennifer Crumbley.

item.title: Woman shoots drivers, says God told her to because of eclipse
item.description: The suspect "checked out of a local hotel and told the staff she was going on a shooting spree, directed by 'God' in relation to the solar eclipse," police said.

item.title: Dozens of guards, ex-judge push to scrap Missouri double murderer's execution
item.description: Brian Dorsey is scheduled to be executed in Missouri for a double slaying in 2009. But dozens of prison guards and a former state Supreme Court justice are among those who want his life spared.

item.title: Cambodia sees rise in YouTuber abuse of monkeys at world heritage site
item.description: YouTubers can earn a living from videos interacting with monkeys at the Angkor world heritage site, but some videos show horrific abuse.

item.title: Zoo animals got quiet, exhibited nighttime behavior during total solar eclipse
item.description: During the eclipse, zoo animals across the U.S. displayed some unique behaviors, such as acting as they usually do at night.

item.title: Doctors take on dental duties to reach low-income and uninsured patients
item.description: More doctors are integrating oral health care into their practices, filling a need in America's dental deserts.

item.title: 4/8: Prime Time with John Dickerson
item.description: Total solar eclipse cuts path across U.S. ; Students help NASA collect eclipse data

item.title: Jack Smith urges Supreme Court to reject Trump immunity bid in election case
item.description: Special counsel Jack Smith pushed the Supreme Court on Monday to reject former President Donald Trump's sweeping immunity claim in the 2020 election interference case. CBS News Justice Department reporter Robert Legare unpacks the filing.

item.title: What a total solar eclipse can teach us
item.description: While millions of people gawked at the skies for an eclipse experience Monday, teams of scientists were running experiments behind the scenes. Edmund Nowak, professor and chair of the Department of Physics and Astronomy at the University of Delaware, joins CBS News to discuss his research.

item.title: Total solar eclipse cuts path across U.S.
item.description: Millions in the U.S., Mexico and Canada were able to see a total solar eclipse on Monday. The eclipse's path of totality cut through 15 states, but even those outside the path were still able to see a partial eclipse. "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell reports.

item.title: Idaho teen arrested for allegedly plotting to attack church in name of ISIS
item.description: An 18-year-old from Idaho has been arrested and accused of plotting to kill churchgoers in his town in the name of ISIS​, court documents say.

item.title: Trump says he's proud of role in overturning Roe v. Wade
item.description: Former President Trump said in a statement Monday he was proud of his role in overturning Roe v. Wade, but stopped short of supporting a full nationwide ban on abortion. But some of the former president's supporters, and also President Biden, believe Trump would sign such a ban if it made its way to his desk during a second term. Weijia Jiang reports.

item.title: Bill Nye discusses total solar eclipse
item.description: Bill Nye "The Science Guy" got to see the total solar eclipse from Fredericksburg, Texas. He spoke with "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell about what it was like.

item.title: Towns and cities in path of totality see economic boost
item.description: The 2024 eclipse also brought with it an economic boom for cities and towns in the path of totality. Millions of people from around the world traveled to get a glimpse of the celestial event. Janet Shamlian has more.

item.title: Gunman kills two at law office in Las Vegas
item.description: A gunman killed two people in a Las Vegas law office on Monday. The gunman is also dead, police say. Elise Preston has the latest.

item.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, April 8, 2024
item.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."

item.title: UConn dominates Purdue to win NCAA men's basketball tournament
item.description: The Connecticut Huskies are the 2024 NCAA Division 1 men's basketball champions after defeating the Purdue Boilermakers 75-60

item.title: Congress returns from 2-week break with Ukraine aid still stalled
item.description: Lawmakers returned to Capitol Hill on Monday after a two-week-long break with several priorities left to address, including aid to Ukraine. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion unpacks the number of issues Congress hopes to tackle.

item.title: Trump takes credit for Roe v. Wade reversal; says states should decide abortion laws
item.description: Former President Donald Trump took credit on Monday for ending the constitutional right to abortion but said the issue is now up to the states. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more.

item.title: A look at eclipse celebrations across U.S.
item.description: A rare total eclipse was visible from Mexico to Canada on Monday, with millions across North America experiencing the celestial phenomenon. "CBS Evening News" anchor and managing editor Norah O'Donnell reports from Indianapolis. Then, CBS News correspondent Janet Shamlian looks at the event's economic impact.

item.title: How to plan a Sam's Club Member's Mark wedding: 5 tips to save money on your big day
item.description: Weddings are expensive, but they don't have to be. Get a ring, flowers, cake, food and more from Sam's Club.

item.title: Where U.S.-China relations stand as Yellen wraps up economic talks
item.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen held economic talks with Chinese officials in Beijing over the weekend, calling them "productive, direct and extensive." Scott Kennedy, senior adviser at the Center for Strategic and International Studies, joins CBS News to assess what Yellen's trip to Beijing will mean for the relationship between the world's largest economies.

item.title: Scale of destruction in Gaza evident after most Israeli troops withdraw
item.description: With most of Israel's troops withdrawn from Gaza in preparation for a new phase of the war, thousands of Palestinians were able to move freely for the first time in months. It also provided a glimpse at the level of destruction in the Gaza Strip. Holly Williams reports.

item.title: Missed the total solar eclipse? Watch moments from the event.
item.description: A total solar eclipse darkened skies across the U.S. Tens of millions witnessed it in the "path of totality."

item.title: Special counsel pushes Supreme Court to reject Trump's immunity bid
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear arguments on April 25 on whether former President Donald Trump is entitled to presidential immunity from criminal prosecution.

item.title: Students help NASA collect eclipse data
item.description: A high school class in Indiana used a special telescope during the 2024 solar eclipse to help NASA collect data on the sun's corona.

item.title: Mitch McConnell backs House TikTok bill that could lead to ban
item.description: Momentum for the bill that could eventually lead to a ban on TikTok has slowed in the Senate.

item.title: New York RFK Jr. campaign official suggests he's a spoiler who can help Trump win
item.description: "The only way that Trump can even (have a) remote possibility of taking New York is if Bobby is on the ballot," said RFK Jr. staffer Rita Palma.
